verse.text: Paul, an apostle (not from men nor through man but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised Him from the dead),
"And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, by no means are you the least among the princes of Judah; for out of you shall come forth a Ruler, One who will shepherd My people Israel."
To the place of the altar, which he had made there formerly; and there Abram called on the name of Jehovah.
To the place of the altar, which he had made there formerly; and there Abram called on the name of Jehovah.
I gave you milk to drink, not solid food, for you were not yet able to receive it. But neither yet now are you able,
I gave you milk to drink, not solid food, for you were not yet able to receive it. But neither yet now are you able,
And I will make My covenant between Me and you, / And I will multiply you exceedingly.
Then Abraham fell upon his face and laughed and said in his heart, Will a child be born to a man who is a hundred years old? And will Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear a child?
承認自己的罪，在約旦河裡受了他的洗。
But seek first His kingdom and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
But seek first His kingdom and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
And stretching out His hand, He touched him, saying, I am willing; be cleansed! And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
And stretching out His hand, He touched him, saying, I am willing; be cleansed! And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

And he will be like a tree transplanted beside water, / Which sends out its roots by a stream, / And will not be afraid when heat comes; / For its leaves remain flourishing, / And it will not be anxious in the year of drought / And will not cease to bear fruit.
And God said to Moses, I AM WHO I AM. And He said, Thus you shall say to the children of Israel, I AM has sent me to you.
Now these are the ordinances which you shall set before them.

text: In contrast to commandments in previous chapter

verse.text: He said to Him, Which ones? And Jesus said, "You shall not murder; you shall not commit adultery; you shall not steal; you shall not bear false witness;
Seven days you shall make expiation for the altar and sanctify it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
Seven days you shall make expiation for the altar and sanctify it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
Saying to them, Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied and a colt with her; untie them and lead them to Me.
Saying to them, Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied and a colt with her; untie them and lead them to Me.
And you shall anoint them as you have anointed their father that they may serve Me as priests; and their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.

text: The anointing is to the priests, for the priesthood

verse.text: And when Jesus had finished giving instructions to His twelve disciples, He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
But if they confess their iniquity and the iniquity of their fathers, in their unfaithfulness which they committed against Me, and also that they walked contrary to Me,
And He groaned deeply in His spirit and said, Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I tell you, No sign shall be given to this generation.

text: In the previous chapter He groaned over deafness and dumbness

verse.text: And He groaned deeply in His spirit and said, Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I tell you, No sign shall be given to this generation.

text: In the previous chapter He groaned over deafness and dumbness

verse.text: And they said, Moses allowed us to write a certificate of divorce and divorce her.

text: He asked: what did Moses command? They answered what he allowed.

verse.text: And they said, Moses allowed us to write a certificate of divorce and divorce her.

text: He asked: what did Moses command? They answered what he allowed.

verse.text: And He would not let anyone carry a vessel through the temple.

text: I wonder if this is related to the ephah vessel representing commerce

verse.text: And the heart and soul of the multitude of those who had believed was one; and not even one said that any of his possessions was his own, but all things were common to them.
And Israel made a vow to Jehovah and said, If You will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.
But Jehovah was infuriated with me on your account and did not listen to me. And Jehovah said to me, Enough! Speak no more to Me about this matter.

text: Good was angry on about of (behalf of?) the people

verse.text: You go near and hear all that Jehovah our God says; then you will speak to us all that Jehovah our God speaks to you, and we will hear and do.

text: "We will do" here is connected with not wanting the presence of God.

verse.text: And Jehovah said to me, They have done well in what they have spoken.

text: They have done well because they could not be in God's presence

verse.text: And this shall be the case of the manslayer who flees there and lives: He who slays his neighbor without intent and did not hate him previously—
(For the redemption of their soul is costly / And must be given up forever),
(For the redemption of their soul is costly / And must be given up forever),
See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Touch Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you behold Me having.

text: The answer to trouble and doubts- touch the resurrected pneumatic Christ!

verse.text: See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Touch Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you behold Me having.

text: The answer to trouble and doubts- touch the resurrected pneumatic Christ!

verse.text: Again therefore Jesus spoke to them, saying, I am the light of the world; he who follows Me shall by no means walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

text: The light of the world does not condemn, but gives life to live a life that sins no more (v 11)

verse.text: And the Angel of Jehovah appeared to the woman and said to her, Now you are barren and have borne no children; but you will conceive and bear a son.

text: He spoke a truthful and enlightening word, but a supplying and faith-infusing word as well.

verse.text: And he returned the eleven hundred pieces of silver to his mother; and his mother said, I do consecrate the silver to Jehovah from my hand to my son to make a sculptured idol and a molten image. Now therefore I will return it to you.

text: A good-intentioned consecration with a most horrible result

verse.text: Satisfy us in the morning with Your lovingkindness / That we may give a ringing shout and rejoice all our days.
Then Samuel told the people the practice of the kingdom, and he wrote it in a book and laid it before Jehovah. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

text: The kings did not decide the practice of the kingdom

verse.text: Abraham födde Isak, Isak födde Jakob, Jakob födde Judas och hans bröder;
He opened the rock, and water gushed forth; / It ran in the dry places like a river.

text: Opened the rock- like opening Adam's side

verse.text: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, / And would have, had not Moses His chosen one / Stood in the breach before Him / To turn away His wrath from destroying them.

text: Poetic language? Or is the breach the cleft rock?

verse.text: And when David's servants came to Abigail at Carmel, they spoke to her, saying, David has sent us to you, to take you to himself as wife.
The Spirit of Jehovah spoke through me, / And His word was on my tongue.
Whatever prayer, whatever supplication, which will be made by any man of all Your people Israel, each knowing the plague of his own heart, when he spreads out his hands toward this house;

text: The plague of his own heart!

verse.text: Let my prayer be set before You as incense, / The lifting up of my hands as the evening offering.
And they spoke to him, saying, If today you will be a servant to this people and serve them and answer them and speak good words to them, then they will be your servants always.

text: First to serve - servant leadership. Not like the Son of Man, however.

verse.text: But now, apart from the law, the righteousness of God has been manifested, witness being borne to it by the Law and the Prophets;

text: The law here is not the means but the witness of righteousness

verse.text: And he said to him, Say to her, You have gone to all this trouble for us; what can be done for you? Should you be spoken of to the king or to the captain of the army? And she said, I dwell in the midst of my people.
A righteous man regards the life of his beast, / But the inward parts of the wicked are cruel.
A fool's anger is known at once, / But a prudent man conceals shame.

text: Elders training- don't be quick to reprimand publicly

verse.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah, / But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
Do not love sleep, or else you will come to poverty; / Open your eyes, and be satisfied with bread.

text: For me- all kinds of poverty

verse.text: And when the trumpeters and the singers were one to make themselves heard with one voice in praising and in giving thanks to Jehovah, and when they lifted up their voice with trumpets and with cymbals and with musical instruments in praise to Jehovah, saying, For He is good, for His lovingkindness is forever; then the house, the house of Jehovah, was filled with a cloud.
Can you find out the depths of God? / Can you find out the limit of the Almighty?
He removes the understanding of the heads of the people of the earth / And causes them to wander in a pathless waste.
The light is sweet, and it is pleasant for the eyes to see the sun.
Since you seek a proof of the Christ who is speaking in me, who is not weak unto you but is powerful in you.
The countenance of their faces witnesses against them, / And they declare their sin like Sodom; / They do not hide it. / Woe to their soul! / For they have brought evil upon themselves.
Then He will become a sanctuary, yet a stone to strike against / And a rock of stumbling / To both houses of Israel, / A trap and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

text: The stumbling stone is still linked to the building

verse.text: I will make mortal man rarer than pure gold, / And mankind rarer than the gold of Ophir.
The sinners in Zion are terrified; / Trembling has seized the profane: / Who among us can dwell with consuming fire? / Who among us can dwell with everlasting burning?

text: Our God is a consuming fire

verse.text: The prophets prophesy falsely, / And the priests rule by their own authority; / And My people love it this way. / But what will you do at the end of it?
And at the end of ten days the word of Jehovah came to Jeremiah.
And they will not take from you a stone for the corner / Or a stone for the foundations; / For you will be an eternal desolation, declares Jehovah.

Your prophets have seen for you / Vanity and folly, / And they have not uncovered your iniquity / To turn again your captivity; / But they have seen for you burdens / Of vanity and of causes of banishment.

text: Cf the Lord's cherishing by speaking of judgment

verse.text: Though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in the midst of it, they would deliver only their own souls by their righteousness, declares the Lord Jehovah.

And the captivity of this host of the children of Israel, / Who are among the Canaanites, will possess as far as Zarephath; / And the captivity of Jerusalem, who are in Sepharad, / Will possess the cities of the south.

And they set their hearts like adamant so as not to hear the instruction and the words which Jehovah of hosts sent by His Spirit through the former prophets; therefore great wrath came from Jehovah of hosts.

text: Cf tablets of hearts of flesh

verse.text: And the temple of God which is in heaven was opened, and the Ark of His Covenant was seen in His temple; and there were lightnings and voices and thunders and an earthquake and great hail.
